casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. DEBRUYNE
v.
LUCAS CTY. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, Juvenile Div. 2018-0941 Supreme Court of Ohio. October 10, 2018

CASE ANNOUNCEMENTS

O'Connor, C.J., and O'Donnell, Kennedy, French, Fischer, DeWine, and DeGenaro, JJ., concur.

MERIT DECISIONS WITHOUT OPINIONS

In Prohibition. On answer of respondents and respondents' motion for judgment on the pleadings. Motion denied. Sua sponte, alternative writ granted. The following briefing schedule is set for presentation of evidence and filing of briefs pursuant to S.Ct.Prac.R. 12.05: The parties shall file any evidence they intend to present within 20 days, relator shall file a brief within 10 days after the filing of the evidence, respondent shall file a brief within 20 days after the filing of relator's brief, and relator may file a reply brief within 7 days after the filing of respondent's brief.
